result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley M Hardwick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution and statutorily authorized surcharge has been paid in full.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.  Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges granted.  60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bradley M Hardwick in court with attorney Peter R. Heyne.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews max. penalties, elements.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1.  Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1.  Counts 2-5 are dismissed but read in for sentencing.  Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations.  Defendant makes statement. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Bradley M Hardwick in court. Attorney Peter R. Heyne appeared by phone. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that case will resolve with probation and conditional jail time, trying to work out interstate compact with Michigan, requests plea/sentencing hearing.  Bond continues as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Bradley M Hardwick in court with attorney Peter R Heyne.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.  Bond continues as is.  Defense can appear by phone, or if case will be plea, can be rescheduled to 3/12.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Heyne called requesting this case be moved to 2:30 p.m. on 2/11/2014.  It was originally scheduled for 10:30 a.m. 2/11/2014.  Attorney Heyne is scheduled in Brown County Court in the morning and would like to have it moved to the 2:30 time slot.  After checking with DA Raymond Pelrine and he had no objection it was moved to the 2:30 p.m. time slot.  lw
by State

State's Exhibit 1 - Report of Investigator Zager
Ex. 2 - Supplemental report of Investigator Zager
Both exhibits offered and received.

Defendant Bradley M Hardwick in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is prepared to proceed.  Defense advises that Defendant wants new counsel.  Court questions Defendant on why he wants new counsel.  Defendant spent 14 days in jail and the lawyer never came to see him.  Court does not think that's sufficient cause to call off hearing when witness is here, doesn't think request is timely.  Testimony taken.  Court finds probable cause, binds Defendant over for trial.  Defense will request administrative transfer of attorney.  Arraignment scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 10:30 am.
by Brandon Dickerson.
Defense presents argument for reduced bond.  State presents argument against reduction of bond.  Court will not amend bond at this time, would be willing to hear arguments after prelim.

Defendant Bradley M Hardwick in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Defendant Bradley M Hardwick in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases
by Defendant
Defendant was fingerprinted on 1/12/14.
No contact direct or indirect with Holiday Music Hotel, MJ.

Defendant Bradley M Hardwick appeared by video conference.  Attorney Eric Maciolek appeared in Court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond.
